```{=html}
<div class="container">
  <!-- Left Column -->
  <div class="left-column">
    <ul class="no-bullets">
      <li><a onclick="loadSection('experience')">Experience</a></li>
      <ul class="no-bullets">
        <li><a onclick="loadSection('data-analytics')">Data & Analytics</a></li>
        <li><a onclick="loadSection('project-manager')">Project Manager/ PMO</a></li>
      </ul>
      <li><a onclick="loadSection('education')">Education</a></li>
      <li><a onclick="loadSection('skills')">Skills</a></li>
    </ul>
  </div>

  <!-- Right Column -->
  <div class="right-column" id="content">
    <!-- Default content -->
    <p>Select a link to view details.</p>
  </div>
</div>

<script>
  // Function to load the selected section
  function loadSection(sectionId) {
    const contentDiv = document.getElementById("content");

    // Prevent the default link behavior (e.g., navigating to a new page)
    event.preventDefault();
    
    // Debug the file path
    console.log(`Fetching: sections/${sectionId}.md`);

    // Fetch the content from the external file
    fetch(`/sections/${sectionId}.md`)
      .then(response => response.text())
      .then(data => {
        // Render the Markdown content as HTML
        contentDiv.innerHTML = marked.parse(data);
      })
      .catch(error => {
        console.error("Error loading section:", error);
        contentDiv.innerHTML = "<p>Error loading content.</p>";
      });
  }
</script>

<!-- Include the Marked.js library for Markdown rendering -->
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/marked/marked.min.js"></script>
```
